result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin R. Ashbacher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any other sentence but concurrent to Taylor County Case No. 15CF25

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution shall be determined within 30 days.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.  Defendant shall complete all programs as deemed by agent including alcohol and drug assessment and follow through with any treatment and counseling as recommended by agent.  Defendant shall write letters of apology to victims.  Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

records.addlTxt: to M.L.W.
Restitution Summary
of Sentencing Hearing held on November 9, 2015 - Mary B. Burzynski, RPR
In Court Notice to Defendant After Sentencing
of MLW
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Benjamin R. Ashbacher in court with attorney Shawn M Paul.  Defendant Benjamin R. Ashbacher in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  There are no factual corrections to the PSI per Attorney Paul.  Victim rights have been complied.  Victim impact statements were filed with the court.  Argument regarding sentence.  Statement by Benjamin Ashbacher.  Court orders 15CF25 and 15CF28 1 year initial confinement; 3 years extended supervision consecutive to any other sentence but concurrent to each other restitution to be determined within 30 days for 15CF28; defendant is eligible for challenge incarceration and substance abuse program; court costs; complete all programs as deemed by agent including alcohol and drug assessment and follow through any treatment and counseling as recommended by the agent; write letters of apology to victims; DNA sample and DNA surcharge; no sentence credit as he is receiving the credit on his other cases.  Attorney Paul indicating that they are not objecting to the restitution for case 15CF25.  - rt
Days Credit Worksheet

records.addlTxt: Defendant Benjamin R. Ashbacher in court with attorney Shawn M Paul.  Defendant Benjamin R. Ashbacher in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Victim rights complied.  Defendant freely and voluntarily waives right to a preliminary hearing.  Written waiver of preliminary hearing filed with the court.  Information filed.  Waive reading of Information.  Plea of no contest to 15CF25 and 15CF28.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty in cases 15CF25 and 15CF28.  15CF27 and Price County Case 15CF40 are dismissed and read in.  Court orders a PSI.  - rt

Defendant Benjamin R. Ashbacher in court with attorney Shawn M Paul.  Defendant Benjamin R. Ashbacher in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of complaints.  Waive time limits for a preliminary hearing.  Bond continued.   Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.  - rt
Statements
for Benjamin R. Ashbacher
Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.
Arrest Report
Initial Appearance on 6-02-2015 at 1:00 p.m.

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Benjamin R. Ashbacher appeared in court, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.   Attorney Tlusty requesting a $2,500.00 cash bond and booking.  Court orders cash bond of $2,500.00 and booking.  Defendant requested a speedy trial and plea of guilty.  Court advised defendant of right to an attorney.  Next court date is June 2, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.  - rt
